subject: Re: [junit] MockObjects/JDBC: I don't have to call executeUpdate()
msgSnippet: ... Yes, it was my imagination. addExpectedBlahBlahBlah() When a thing and its name do not match, there is fighting. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Everyone:
>
> Is it my imagination or is there nothing in the MockPreparedStatement
> that I can use in my test that forces me to invoke executeUpdate() or
> executeQuery() on the corresponding statement in my production code?

Yes, it was my imagination.

addExpectedBlahBlahBlah()

When a thing and its name do not match, there is fighting.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
